body:
I can confirm this bug, we are currently running ~80 node processes handled by PM2 on a large server and if I run `pm2 monit` it will start, almost freeze, and running `htop` on another terminal will show one CPU at 100% running `pm2 monit`.
`pm2 monit` in this situation is unusable (not possible to move around with arrow keys etc...)

We are running on a Debian 8 with node v7.3.0 and pm2 v2.4.4

The PM2 consumes 100% CPU usage and apps gets disappeared from list.  

We are running this in

PM2 version:  2.4.2
OS : Windows 7
RAM Memory: 8GB
Node: 4.1.1 (stable)
For anyone having the problem while we are investigating, you can use the old one interface using `pm2 imonit`

@vmarchaud thanks for that, that helps

just an update, im still getting this issue but much less impact-full bouncing between 10% and 80% usage on my dual core, im now using node v8.1.0
We were investigating the problem and didn't find a root cause, we need more time to make a decision on what to do to fix this issue.

issue.title: Feature request - pm2 bounce itself to clear out log viewer and lower cpu

repository.name: pm2
repository.description: Node.js Production Process Manager with a built-in Load Balancer.

issue.body:
**What's going wrong?**

When using `pm monit` and app has continues logging...like once every three seconds, cpu will slowly increase over the course of a few hours.

**feature request**

Have pm2 monitor bounce it's self once every N hours. Allow it to be set by the user according to the log activity.  

## Supporting information

```
PM2 version: `2.5.0`
Node version: `8.0.0`
  Linux
```

body: Is it the monitor itself eating the cpu or the log that scrolls? I tend to think it's the log that scrolls and when it becomes large enough, it forces expensive redraws on the terminal graphics.
@dman777 from my research it as a low impact on performance, it was basically eating CPU without any update rendered on the screen.

I did a test with pm2 monit:

1) overnight - app logs every 3 seconds.... morning time cpu was pegged at 14%
2) 2nd overnight - logging disabled. cpu was about 1%

I can confirm this bug too.

**OS Information**
pm2 version: 2.5.0
nodejs version: 6.11.2
OS: Debian Jessie

**Steps to reproduce**
1. Scale this script to 1 process per core
```javascript
setInterval(() => {
    console.log('foo');
}, 250)
```

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/4057473/29024510-ac2d6382-7b72-11e7-8e82-5bbff7ae27ba.png)

2. Start pm2 monit.
3. 6 processes which consumes around 18% CPU together

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/4057473/29024544-d395b1ae-7b72-11e7-9f0f-ced47d8c1bd4.png)

this is no longer an issue for me, tho i do some times see large usage but normally clears after some time.
@dman777 logging quantity made no difference for me in the past, i print very minimal logs to console, the alternative suggested `imonit` is all i need anyways and i still use that tho the error has cleared for me

woke up this morning to the cpu usage of the machine slowly been creeping up over time, this issue has returned
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/8790525/29622544-a44d2e62-881b-11e7-8260-dd17e38adeeb.png)
relaunching the `pm2 monit` cleared the issue but i still cant pin whats causing it, in that time gap around 100 lines was printed to the console with 6 active node applications

just updating server property's too as they have changed since original post

```
OS         : CentOS `3.10.0-514.26.2.el7.x86_64`
node.js    : v8.2.1
PM2        : v2.6.1
```

_pm2 monit_ is still reaching 100% of cpu, no logging, screen unresponsive. 
What is found by the investigation?  
My linux presents the same problem: 

pm2 the latest: 2.6.1
Node v6.9.4 
Distributor ID:	Ubuntu
Description:	Ubuntu 14.04.5 LTS
Release:	14.04
Codename:	trusty

I think this is very common. And makes monit not usable in long run.

confirm that
100% of CPU usage and ssh has been freezed
![monit](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/7139967/30539857-14abc41e-9c7d-11e7-9ff5-55beebbeee65.jpg)
. Reconnection is required

I confirm on our side too. PM2 2.7.1 and 2.7.2
On AWS servers and my own desktop too (Ubuntu 17.04).
I confirm this on Windows server 2012.
